CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper December 22, 1945, pg. 4, reads: "'What Do You Want Santa to Bring You?' - Christmas parties, plays and carols are part of the festivities that were enjoyed by the students of city schools as a prelude to their holiday fun. The Parent-Teacher Association of Vann School started things off with an ice cream treat at Vann School Wednesday, at which the children were served refreshments. Best of all was the visit from Santa Claus. The 'Spirit of Christmas" is handing Santa Claus the magic bell. Little Linda Jackson sits entranced on Santa's knee as he tells her all about conditions at the North Pole. On Thursday and Friday plays were given and parties were held in different class rooms. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Man wearing Santa Claus costume standing on small stage leaning toward girl wearing "spirit of Christmas" costume, with Christmas tree in background for PTA program at Vann School
